content: You can get Materials by the §lMaterialRegistry§r.

§l○§r §o§nMaterialRegistry.get(String materialName)§r get §nMaterial§r by name.

 §l○§r §o§nMaterialRegistry.getAllMaterials()§r get §nMaterial§r List.

 §l○§r §o§ngetChemicalFormula()§r get default formula.

 §l○§r §o§nmaterialRGB§r get default materialRGB.

 §l○§r §o§nradioactive§r get default radioactive.

 §l○§r §o§nprotons§r get default protons.

 §l○§r §o§nneutrons§r get default neutrons.

 §l○§r §o§nmass§r get default mass.

 §l○§r §o§naverageProtons§r get default averageProtons.

 §l○§r §o§naverageNeutrons§r get default averageNeutrons.

 §l○§r §o§naverageMass§r get default averageMass.

 §l○§r §o§nblastTemperature§r get default blastTemperature.

 §l○§r §o§ncamelCaseName§r get default camelCaseName.

 §l○§r §o§nunlocalizedName§r get default unlocalizedName.

 §l○§r §o§nlocalizedName§r get default localizedName.

 §l○§r §o§nname§r get default name.

§l○§r §o§nsetFormula(String formula, @Optional boolean withFormatting)§r Set the formula of this Material.

 §l○§r §o§naddFlags(String... names)§r Add additional flags to this Material.

 §l○§r §o§nsetMaterialRGB(int materialRGB)§r Set the color of this Material.

 §l○§r §o§nsetFormula(String formula, @Optional boolean withFormatting)§r Set the formula of this Material.
